definition: scenery hung at back of stage, to understate the importance or quality of
details:
noun
- scenery hung at back of stage
= synonyms: backdrop
- (computer science) the area of the screen in graphical user interfaces against which icons and windows appear
= synonyms: desktop, screen background
- a person's social heritage: previous experience or training
= example: a person's social heritage: previous experience or training
- information that is essential to understanding a situation or problem
= example: information that is essential to understanding a situation or problem
= synonyms: background knowledge
- the part of a scene or picture ,that lies behind objects in the foreground
= example: the part of a scene or picture ,that lies behind objects in the foreground
= synonyms: ground
- relatively unimportant or inconspicuous accompanying situation
= example: relatively unimportant or inconspicuous accompanying situation
- extraneous signals that can be confused with the phenomenon to be observed or measured
= example: extraneous signals that can be confused with the phenomenon to be observed or measured
= synonyms: background signal
- the state of the environment in which a situation exists
= synonyms: setting, scope
verb
- to understate the importance or quality of
= example: to understate the importance or quality of
= synonyms: play down, downplay
